meanings.definition: The unit of inductance in the International System of Units, equivalent to the inductance of a closed circuit in which an electromotive force of one volt is produced when the electric current in the circuit varies uniformly at a rate of one ampere per second.
meanings.sent1: I learned about henries in my science class.
meanings.sent2: The engineer measured the inductance in henries.
meanings.sent3: The henries in the circuit were dancing to the rhythm of the electric current.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of henries was as deep as the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The concept of henries finally clicked in my mind after the experiment.

meanings.sent1: The Henries gathered for a family reunion.
meanings.sent2: I met two brothers named Henries.
meanings.sent3: The Henries enjoyed a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the Henries were known for their kindness.
meanings.sent5: The name Henries has a classic ring to it.
